title: Print, "Versailles, Gardens, The Pleasures of the Enchanted Isle.", 1664
medium: Etching and engraving. Black ink on rolled paper.
inscribed:
Engraved on the plate at left of banner:  "Israel Silvestre del, et Scul. parifus"
Inscription on banner at lower center:  "Les plaisirs de l'Isle enchantee, ou les festes, et divertissements du Roy, a Versailles, Diuisez entrois journees, et commencez le 7 Jour du May, de L'anne 1664.  Ces escus charges de deuises sont icy places feton le rang que les chevaliers tenoint dans la marche, et non pas suivant leurs qualites."
Below coat of arms at top center:  "Veue dv chasteav de Versailles."
Numbered at lower right:  "1"
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: In the foreground a banner decorated with shields and coats of arms.  At the top two winged figures hold up the royal coat of arms.  Beyond the Palace of Versailles.  All is framed by curtains and garlands.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "Versailles, Gardens, The Pleasures of the Enchanted Isle.", 1664.
1664. Etching and engraving. Black ink on rolled paper.. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1931-86-51.
